text: Nantua is a commune in the Ain department. It is found in the Auvergne-Rhône- Alpes region in the east of France and is the capital of the arrondissement of Nantua. ==Geography== The commune of Nantua has an area of . Its average altitude is ; at the city hall, the altitude is . The distances from Nantua to other cities are: * Paris, the national capital - ; * Lyon, the regional capital - ; * Reims - ; * Bordeaux - ; * Toulouse - ; * Montpellier - ; * Strasbourg - ; * Nantes - ; * Marseille - . Nantua and its neighboring communes ===Climate=== The climate of Nantua, in the Köppen climate classification, is Cfb - Oceanic climate with template summers. ==Population== The inhabitants of Nantua are known, in French, as Nantuatiens (women: Nantuatiennes). Nantua has a population, in 2014, of 3,534 and its population density is of inhabitants/km2. It is also the capital of the canton of Nantua, formed by 18 communes (21,477 inhabitants) (2014) It is part of the intercommunality Haut Bugey. === Twinned and partner towns === Nantua is twinned with: * Brembilla, Italy, since 2011. == Gallery == File:Nantua (lac, ville, viaduc).JPG|Nantua (lake, town and viaduc). File:Nantua mairie.JPG|Nantua town hall. File:Église Abbatiale Saint-Michel de Nantua.jpg|Saint-Michel church, Nantua. ==Related pages== * Arrondissement of Nantua * Communes of the Ain department ==References== Category:Subprefectures in France Category:Communes in Ain
